alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 4:01AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Kit Carson. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 401 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Interstate 70, as well as secondary roadways will be impacted. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Burlington and Bethune. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
